e4: As a board member, I would not recommend changing to the new policy because it may cause a market perception of declining performance amongst uninformed or small investors due to an unintentional misleading adjustment of earnings in their incorrect view of unbiased performance being bad. Thus, stability appears beneficial relative to the hypothetical minor improvement gained by accounting standards compliance.
e5: I consider an ethical reporting policy to be one that prioritizes clarity, accuracy, and transparency. It should neither intentionally deceive nor harm stakeholders through misrepresentation of financial information. In addition to meeting traditional accounting standards compliance, factors such as potential unintended consequences, relative risk versus reward, and fairness among different investor groups should also influence the evaluation.
e6: What specific initiatives would be proposed to effectively educate both individual and institutional investors about the nature of any changes in accounting practices, potentially mitigating existing market behaviors adverse for some groups, as well as providing additional protections or recourse if investors become economically impacted?
